sub_title: English language professional at Schot in de Roos and Treasurer at Dam, Rotterdams Geld
summary:
People notice good English.

Language just happens to be my thing and there's nothing I enjoy more than helping to improve communications between people and organisations. I was born and brought up in Scotland, studied French and have lived in the Netherlands since 1989. 

When you're trying to reach an international audience, it's worth doing it well.
 
Native English speakers won't always point out your embarrassing mistakes - after all, they are not generally known for their skills in other languages - but they will notice and they might even laugh at you behind your back!

Specialties: 
Dutch to English translation of websites and texts about: 
- Architecture and urban design, particularly for magazines, books and other publications 
- Arts & Culture including film, Dutch Design, museums 
- Management books 

Editing English texts written by Dutch speakers.

projects.title: Stadhuis Rotterdam
projects.description:
Translation of chapter summaries and captions into English.

Het boek Stadhuis Rotterdam. Honderd jaar een baken in de stad vertelt de rijke geschiedenis van een Rotterdams icoon 
Het stadhuis van Rotterdam is het centrale punt van de Coolsingel en vormt het hart van de stad. De opdracht in 1913 aan architect Henri Evers voor het ontwerp van het gebouw was omstreden en vormde het begin van een turbulente geschiedenis. De publicatie Stadhuis Rotterdam brengt voor het eerst de rijke historie van het Rotterdamse stadhuis en zijn omgeving in kaart.

contributors.headline: English language professional at Schot in de Roos and Treasurer at Dam, Rotterdams Geld

projects.title: DASH 10 Housing the Student
projects.description:
Translation of texts into English.
Due to the internationalization of university and higher education, there are very many design assignments for student housing, and offering good quality housing is important when it comes to attracting students. 
Transience, modularity and transformation are recurring themes in the design of student housing. A new development is the conversion of empty buildings that were originally designed for other purposes into student housing. With essays by Dick van Gameren, Paul Kuitenbrouwer and others, and an interview with Marlies Rohmer, the inspiration behind Bouwjong!, the Groningen manifestation for young people’s housing. 
This issue of DASH on Student Housing features an extensive documentation of plans and shows the development of student housing at all different scales. The projects described in the book include the Morse and Ezra Stiles colleges at Yale University by Eero Saarinen, La Fondation Avicenne in Paris by Claude Parent, Heydar Ghiaï and others, the patio dwellings on the Drienerlo campus by Herman Haan and the new building for Leiden University College in The Hague by Wiel Arets.

projects.title: Rotterdam Centraal - Building Above and Below the Ground
projects.description:
Translation of the book, published March 2014 

The Authoritative Book on Rotterdam’s New Central Station
Rotterdam has a new central station for public transport: Rotterdam Centraal. It took many years 
to design and build, and in March 2014 will officially be opened. The Ingenieursbureau Rotterdam in 
collaboration with Team CS, the municipal engineering office, worked on the construction of the remarkable station hall, which features a roof of beaten stainless steel that stretches far over the square adjoining the station. This book takes the reader on a trip through the amazing world of the above and below ground construction of the complex infrastructure of Rotterdam Centraal. Moreover, it extensively highlights the crucial role that Rotterdam’s Ingenieursbureau played in its realization.

projects.title: DASH 8 Building Together
projects.description:
Translation of texts for DASH 8, to be published in July 2013. 
DASH (Delft Architectural Studies on Housing) is a thematic journal that is wholly devoted to residential design. Inquiry into historical and contemporary projects and conditions is the central focus of DASH. New types of housing but also existing models and changing trends will be thoroughly charted and examined. The target is the future: with thought-provoking analyses, DASH aims to give new impetus to innovative housing design.

projects.title: Cycle Infrastructure
projects.description:
Edited the English version of this book.

From bicycle highway to parking tower
Cycling is experiencing a worldwide revival. It is a sustainable, affordable and above all trendy alternative to the car and public transport. Experiments in new cycling facilities are underway everywhere. Cycle Infrastructure includes international examples, interviews with the makers of prominent cycling routes and a glimpse at future innovations.
The possibilities that cycling offers for the spatial quality and the liveability of cities are enormous, but have not been fully exploited. Cycle Infrastructure is an inspiring handbook for anyone interested in the development, design and promotion of high-quality cycling routes. The goal is to activate the full potential of cycling for the (urban) landscape and to consider cycling infrastructure as an integral design challenge instead of purely an issue of traffic engineering. Stefan Bendiks and Aglaée Degros are the founders of Artgineering, a practice for research and design on the boundary between urban planning and infrastructure.

projects.title: Lunar Landscapes Maasvlakte 2
projects.description:
Translation from Dutch to English:
In Lunar Landscapes: Maasvlakte 2 photographer Marie-José Jongerius documents the Port of Rotterdam’s expansion project in an intriguing way. 
The Port of Rotterdam is the largest in Europe, and after Shanghai and Singapore, the largest in the world. With 2,000 hectares of new land to be reclaimed from the sea, the construction of Maasvlakte 2 is one of the largest infrastructure projects in recent years. Through Jongerius’s eyes, however, it is above all an alien landscape and a world of amazement and expectation.
Marie-José Jongerius (b. 1970, De Bilt) studied photography at the Royal Academy of Art in The Hague and with Rineke Dijkstra. She worked with Dana Lixenberg and has exhibited work at the Nederlands Fotomuseum in Rotterdam, the ADC Gallery in New York and the Riverside Art Museum in Los Angeles. In addition to autonomous work Jongerius has worked for The New York Times Magazine, ELLE and Vogue.

projects.title: Robert van 't Hoff, Architect of a New Society
projects.description:
Translation from Dutch to English:
Robert van ’t Hoff was one of the founders of De Stijl, the group of artists centred round the magazine of the same name. He proved himself to be a critical member of the international avant-garde, with his architectural designs and theoretical writings. As an architect, his aim was to play an influential role in the realization of a new society with greater social equality and less private property. He designed several residential communes and he wrote fiery manifestos to achieve his aims.

In this first monograph about Robert van ’t Hoff, all his projects are described and richly illustrated; furthermore, Van ’t Hoff’s most important writings have been included. Three authors analyse the development in his fascinating body of work, the underlying philosophy and the significance of this radical architect for whom art and revolution were so closely linked.

projects.title: Value-based Project Management
projects.description:
Translation of this book by Nicoline Mulder into English.
Complex projects seem to be more chaos than order. Timescales are not met, there is no question of control and conflicts are more often the rule than the exception. In short: complete chaos. Try keeping your client satisfied in this situation. But it really is possible to recognize order in this chaos; it’s simply a matter of looking at the situation differently. Value-based Project Management helps here. From the perspective of chaos theory, eleven interventions are provided: Project’s Eleven.

projects.title: DASH 9 Housing Exhibitions
projects.description:
Translation of texts into English
DASH 9 focuses on the objectives, results, and consequences of housing exhibitions. Essays by Frederique van Andel, Lucy Craegh, Sandra Wagner-Conzelmann, and Noud de Vreeze make connections between various exhibitions and major milestones in the history of residential architecture. Housing exhibitions in which the houses themselves are displayed as built objects (either temporary or permanent ones) had a major influence on the development of the twentieth century’s residential architecture.

profile_positions.description:
Schot in the Roos is owned and run by native speaker Christine Gardner and provides quality translation services from Dutch to English and editing of English texts, particularly those written by Dutch speakers.

A Quickscan service is available as a final check on important texts written in English by non-native speakers, to make sure there are no embarrassing mistakes or ambiguous sentences. For instance, CVs, social media profiles, letters and websites.
profile_positions.title: English language professional

profile_positions.description:
Dam is Rotterdam's very own local money. It helps small independent businesses, individuals and the city's economy by stimulating local trade. Every Dam spent circulates in the city, unlike the euros we spend at national or global companies. Dam is also a community and a marketplace.
 
Together with my fellow team members, I am responsible for supporting and developing this alternative way of buying and selling goods and services so that Dam becomes even stronger and more useful for all its participants and the city as a whole..
